answers.Answer:
Most of our movies have closed captioning or SDH subtitles (a newer form of closed captioning). To use Closed Captioning, it must be enabled on your device. Here's how:

At the Box

1. The title details page will indicate either closed captioning or SDH.
2. We recommend renting a Blu-rayTM disc that has SDH.
*Please note that Blu-rayTM discs only play in Blu-rayTM players.


On Demand

1. All On Demand titles have SDH functionality.
2. This feature is controlled through the player menu.

If you need additional help, contact our Customer Care Team at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat.

There are a few reasons why your disc might not play. The list below offers a few remedies.

1. Clean the disc by wiping the disc from the center outwards using a soft cloth (no paper towels). Clean the disc with a solution of water and mild detergent or rubbing alcohol. Never use abrasives, solvents, or highly acidic cleansers.
2. Ensure that you are playing the correct disc in the correct player with compatible accessories. (For example, playing a Blu-rayTM disc in a Blu-rayTM player with compatabile Blue-rayTM accessories or playing 4K UHD in a 4K UHD player.)
3. Try another disc in the player to verify that the player is not the source of the problem.

If the disc still doesn’t play properly, you can report this thorugh our IVR at 1-866-733-2693 (Option 1) by entering the barcode and your payment information. Return the disc to our Box (before or after reporting this) to prevent additional nightly rental charges.

If the Watch button isn't available, check to make sure your rental hasn’t expired. The time left in your rental period is listed on the movie or TV show's detail page. If it hasn’t expired, try the following:

Mobile Device (Phone/Tablet)

1. Verify your mobile device has all necessary software upgrades.
2. Verify that you are on the current version of the application.
3. Verify your data/Wi-Fi connection is strong enough. We recommend a minimum of 3.0 megabits per second (Mbps).
4. Close the mobile app and try again.
5. Power cycle the device.

Web Browser

1. Verify that your computer has all available software upgrades.
2. Verify that you are on the current version of the browser (or a supported version).
3. Verify your data/Wi-Fi connection is strong enough. We recommend a minimum 3.0 megabits per second (Mbps)..
4. Close the browser and try again.
5. Restart your computer.

If this doesn't solve the problem, contact our Customer Care Team at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

If you're having trouble with closed captioning, it may be because you have a newer TV or player, and the closed captioning signal is analog. Newer HDTV sets, Blu-Ray™ and DVD players use an HDMI connection. HDMI won't play the analog closed captioning on some DVDs. HDMI will play SDH, a newer form of closed captioning. If you rent a disc with SDH subtitles, your remote's CC button might not play them, but you can enable them from the disc menu.

For help with activating closed captioning, refer to the table below:

Mobile Device App

1. Tap the Audio & Subtitles icon in the bottom right of the player screen.
2. Choose closed captioning.

Computer/Laptop

1. Select the Settings icon in the bottom right of the player (it is shaped like a gear).
2. Turn on closed captioning.

Roku, Smart TV, or similar device

1. Use the device or player controls to turn on closed captioning.

Disc in Video Player

1. Go to the TV menu to turn on closed captioning.


If that doesn’t solve the problem, contact our Customer Care Team https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

Most of our movies have closed captioning or SDH subtitles (a newer form of closed captioning). To use Closed Captioning, it must be enabled on your device. Here's how:

At the Box

1. The title details page will indicate either closed captioning or SDH.
2. We recommend renting a Blu-rayTM disc that has SDH.
*Please note that Blu-rayTM discs only play in Blu-rayTM players.


On Demand

1. All On Demand titles have SDH functionality.
2. This feature is controlled through the player menu.

If you need additional help, contact our Customer Care Team at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat.

Redbox on Demand is designed to play the highest quality video that can be delivered over your internet connection. The following table provides general troubleshooting for common video performance issues such as buffering:

Mobile Device (Phone/Tablet)

1. Verify your mobile device has all necessary software upgrades.
2. Verify that you are on the current version of the application.
3. Verify your data/Wi-Fi connection is strong enough. We recommend a minimum of 3.0 megabits per second (Mbps).
4. Close the mobile app and try again.
5. Power cycle the device.

Web Browser

1. Verify that your computer has all available software upgrades.
2. Verify that you are on the current version of the browser (or a supported version).
3. Verify your data/Wi-Fi connection is strong enough. We recommend a minimum 3.0 megabits per second (Mbps)..
4. Close the browser and try again.
5. Restart your computer.

If this doesn't solve the problem, contact our Customer Care Team at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

Use the following troubleshooting steps to address audio performance issues:

General Troubleshooting Tips

1. Make sure the volume is turned up, both on your device and your Redbox Video Player.
2. Try the sound on another device. If it works, the stream is fine and the issue is related to the device.
3. Try playing another title.

Mobile Device (Phone/Tablet)

1. Verify your mobile device has all necessary software upgrades.
2. Verify that you are on the current version of the application.
3. Verify your data/Wi-Fi connection is strong enough. We recommend a minimum of 3.0 megabits per second (Mbps).
4. Close the mobile app and try again.
5. Power cycle the device.

Web Browser

1. Verify that your computer has all available software upgrades.
2. Verify that you are on the current version of the browser (or a supported version).
3. Verify your data/Wi-Fi connection is strong enough. We recommend a minimum 3.0 megabits per second (Mbps).
4. Close the browser and try again.
5. Restart your computer.

If this doesn't solve the problem, contact our Customer Care Team at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

If you can't find the Redbox channel on Roku, make sure your system is updated by following these simple steps:

1. From settings, select System.
2. Select System Update.
3. Select Check Now.


If this doesn't fix the issue, contact Roku for support at https://support.roku.com/article/208756388-how-do-i-add-channels-to-my-roku-streaming-device-.

answers.Summary: Viewing rentals and purchases in My Library
answers.Answer:
Rented and purchased titles are located in https://www.redbox.com/library. Rentals are automatically removed from your library when they expire.

To see titles currently in your library:

Online

Titles are located in https://www.redbox.com/library


Mobile App

1. Click on My Redbox
2. Select the Library tab

Your device has a brightness level that you can adjust to your preferences. If the problem continues, visit the Help Center for your device or contact the manufacturer for assistance. We've provided a few helpful links below.

Apple TV - https://support.apple.com/apple-tv
Samsung TV - https://www.samsung.com/us/support/televisions-home-theater/tvs
LG TV - https://www.lg.com/us/support/tvs
Vizio TV - https://support.vizio.com/s/?language=en_US

This is typically a device-specific issue. Use the table below to help with general troubleshooting:

Mobile Device (Phone/Tablet)

1. Verify your mobile device has all necessary software upgrades.
2. Verify that you are on the current version of the application.
3. Close the mobile app and try again.
4. Power cycle the device.

Web Browser

1. Verify that your computer has all available software upgrades.
2. Verify that you are on the current version of the browser (or a supported version).
3. Close the browser and try again.
4. Restart your computer.

Roku or Smart TV

1. Check for available software and firmware upgrades.
2. Restart the device.
3. Re-launch the application.

If this doesn't solve the problem, contact our Customer Care Team at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

Mobile Device (Phone/Tablet)

answers.Summary: Removing a device from my account
answers.Answer:
You can remove a device from your account by following the steps below:

Mobile Device App

1. Select My Redbox.
2. Select the account icon at the top of the screen.
3. Select On Demand Settings.
4. Scroll to Manage Registered Devices.
5. Select the device you wish to remove.
6. Review the confirmation message and select Remove.

Computer/Laptop

1. Visit https://www.redbox.com.
2. Sign in with your email and password.
3. Select Settings.
4. Scroll down to On Demand Settings - Manage Registered Devices.
5. Select Edit next to the device that you would like to remove.
6. Select "Remove."

If this doesn't solve the problem, contact our Customer Care Team at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

Some devices do not support HD playback and will play the SD version of the video by default. Check your device compatibility to ensure that it’s capable of streaming HD videos before renting or purchasing the HD version of a movie or TV show. For general troubleshooting tips, refer to the following table:

Mobile Device (Phone/Tablet)

1. Verify your mobile device has all necessary software upgrades.
2. Verify that you are on the current version of the application.
3. Close the mobile app and try again.
4. Power cycle the device.

Web Browser

1. Verify that your computer has all available software upgrades.
2. Verify that you are on the current version of the browser (or a supported version).
3. Close the browser and try again.
4. Restart your computer.

Roku or Smart TV

1. Check for available software and firmware upgrades.
2. Restart the device.
3. Re-launch the application.

If this doesn't solve the problem, contact our Customer Care Team at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

Make sure Silverlight is enabled, and you have the latest version installed. You can confirm that it is enabled in the browser settings. If Silverlight is enabled, but you continue to get notified that it is not installed, try uninstalling and reinstalling the application. Download Silverlight at https://www.microsoft.com/silverlight.

If this doecontact our Customer Care Team at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

If your download is progressing at a very slow rate, use the troubleshooting tips below:

Mobile Device (Phone/Tablet)

1. Verify your mobile device has all necessary software upgrades.
2. Verify that you are on the current version of the application.
3. Verify your data/Wi-Fi connection is strong enough. We recommend a minimum of 3.0 megabits per second (Mbps).
4. Close the mobile app and try again.
5. Power cycle the device.


Web Browser

1. Verify that your computer has all available software upgrades.
2. Verify that you are on the current version of the browser (or a supported version).
3. Verify your data/Wi-Fi connection is strong enough. We recommend a minimum of 3.0 megabits per second (Mbps).
4. Close the browser and try again.
5. Restart your computer.

If this doesn't solve the problem, contact our Customer Care Team at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

If your video doesn't fill your entire screen, check to see if you’re in Full Screen mode. In the video player, the Full Screen icon is the right-most icon in the bottom right, next to the gear icon. Clicking it should expand the video player to fill your entire screen.

If that doesn’t solve the problem, contact our Customer Care Team https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

If the wrong movie or TV show is streaming, exit the stream and go back to My Library to make sure you selected the right movie or TV show.

If this doesn't solve the problem, contact our Customer Care Team at https://www.redbox.culp.com/app/chat so we can help.

To install and launch On Demand on your device, visit https://www.redbox.com/howitworks and scroll down to the Setting Up Your Device section. Select the device you want to use and instructions will appear just below it.

If you're having trouble with closed captioning, it may be because you have a newer TV or player, and the closed captioning signal is analog. Newer HDTV sets, Blu-Ray™ and DVD players use an HDMI connection. HDMI won't play the analog closed captioning on some DVDs. HDMI will play SDH, a newer form of closed captioning. If you rent a disc with SDH subtitles, your remote's CC button might not play them, but you can enable them from the disc menu.

For help with activating closed captioning, refer to the table below:

Mobile Device App

1. Tap the Audio & Subtitles icon in the bottom right of the player screen.
2. Choose closed captioning.

Computer/Laptop

1. Select the Settings icon in the bottom right of the player (it is shaped like a gear).
2. Turn on closed captioning.

Roku, Smart TV, or similar device

1. Use the device or player controls to turn on closed captioning.

Disc in Video Player

1. Go to the TV menu to turn on closed captioning.


If that doesn’t solve the problem, contact our Customer Care Team https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

Using your iPhone, iPad, or iPod Touch, you can AirPlay Redbox On Demand movies and TV shows right to your Apple TV.

To enable this service, do the following:

1. Make sure your iPhone, iPad, or iPod Touch is connected to the same wireless network as your Apple TV.
2. Open the Redbox app, and go to your Library found in https://www.redbox.com/library to find the title you want to AirPlay.
3. Start playback by tapping the AirPlay icon and selecting your AirPlay device.

More information on AirPlay is available through https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT204289
If you own the movie or TV show, you can stream on up to five devices simultaneously. If you’ve rented it, you can only stream on one device at a time.

You can register up to five supported devices. The table below lists all supported devices.

Supported Devices

1. LG, Samsung, and VIZIO SmartCast Smart TV
2. Windows or Mac computer
3. Android or iOS mobile or tablet
4. Roku
5. TV via Chromecast
6. Apple TV


Compatable Web Browsers

1. Google Chrome
2. Firefox
3. Internet Explorer*
4. Edge
5. Safari


Recommended Internet Speed

3.0 megabits per second (Mbps)


Silverlight Plugin Required for:

1. IE 11
2. Windows 7
3. Windows 8.1
4. Mac OS older than 10.12 (Sierra)

Download it here: https://www.microsoft.com/silverlight/


For more information on our supported devices, go to https://www.redbox.com/ondemand-howitworks

For more information on using Chromecast, refer to the table below:

Chromecasting Redbox On Demand from an Android or iOS device?

1. Your Android, iOS smartphone or tablet must be on the same wireless network as your Chromecast device.
2. On your smartphone or tablet, open the Redbox app, go to your Redbox Library, and find the title you want to Chromecast.
3. On the title details page, select the Chromecast icon and choose the Chromecast device you want to use to view the content.
4. Once connected, simply start playback of the title.

Chromecasting Redbox On Demand from a Computer

1. Your laptop or desktop computer must be on the same wireless network as your Chromecast device.
2. From your Chrome browser, access Redbox.com
3. Visit My Library, go to the title you want to Chromecast, initiate playback, select the Chromecast icon displayed in the player and choose the Chromecast device you want to use.
4. The Chromecast icon on your browser will turn blue if the cast is active.
5. To stop the cast, click the Chromecast icon and select Stop.

If you need more information on Chromecast, its available through Chromecast Support.

Mobile Device (Phone/Tablet)

Free Live TV may experience playback issues if you have ad blockers enabled. You will get a message within the player to disable the ad blocker to continue viewing content.
You'll find the 3-digit security code on the back of your Discover, Visa, or Mastercard. For American Express, the verification code is the 4 digits on the front of the card.

answers.Summary: Charged twice for rental or purchase
answers.Answer:
Multiple charges may be the result of an authorization hold, which financial institutions sometimes take 3-5 days to release. It may also be for a partial payment collection if we were unable to collect the full balance at one time.

For Rentals - For any transaction involving a rental, you will see an immediate authorization for the one-night balance. The authorization is released when the discs are returned, then you are charged for the amount due based on the nights out. The authorization is released immediately, however your financial institution may take 3-5 days to process this. If you still have concerns, please contact Customer Care at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat

For Purchases - If you were billed multiple times for a disc that was purchased, please contact our Customer Care team to review the details of the transaction. Contact Customer Care at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat

For On Demand - If you were billed multiple times for an On Demand Transaction (Rental or Purchase), please contact our Customer Care team to review the details of the transaction. When using On Demand, be careful to complete the transaction only one time and not select Submit multiple times. Visit Customer Care at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat

Redbox will attempt to collect the full balance due upon return of the disc or at the end of the maximum rental period. If we are unable to collect the full balance due, you may see partial amounts reflected on your email receipt (if the email address was provided during checkout) or reflected within your online account.

Viewing Recent Transactions - Redbox Online Account

1. Login to your online account at https://www.redbox.com.
2. View your transaction history.
3. See if any recent transactions have outstanding balances or recently collected balances

No Online Account - Email Not Provided at Checkout

Contact us and we can review the transaction information with you. You can reach us at 1-866-REDBOX3.


If you still have questions regarding your payment history, contact us at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

After each transaction at the Box, your receipt will show the estimated points you've earned. After you return your rental and make a successful payment, your points will be added within 24-48 hours.

For On Demand, points move faster - and they'll be ready right after you make a successful payment. You can visit https://www.redbox.com/myperks to get a closer look at your points balance and earning history.

You can easily remove a payment card from your account. Follow the steps below depending on the type of device you're using:

Deleting a Payment Card from the Web

1. Login to your account by visiting https://www.redbox.com/account.
2. Access My Accounts - Settings.
3. Scroll to find Payment Methods.
4. Select the Edit or the pencil icon for the payment card.
5. Select Remove.

Deleting a Payment Card from the Mobile App

1. Access the Redbox App.
2. Select My Redbox.
3. Select the Person icon in the upper left-hand corner.
4. Select Payment Method.
5. Select the card to remove.
6. Select Remove

Deleting an E-Gift Card

E-Gift Cards can't be deleted from https://www.redbox.com accounts.

If you need additional help, contact our Customer Care Team at https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat so we can help.

In the Perks program, your points will expire 12 months from the date of earning them. The 12-month time period will begin on the date you completed the transaction (not the date the points appear in your account).

On another note, all of your points will expire after 6 months of account inactivity.

Here are some ways to make sure you stay active:

1. Rent a DVD, Blu-Ray or 4K UHD Disc.
2. Purchase a movie at the Box
3. Make an On Demand transaction

You can go to https://www.redbox.com/myperks to get a closer look at your points balance and earning history.

That's easy - here's a look at our qualifying transactions within the Perks program:

1. Rent a DVD, Blu-Ray or 4K UHD Disc.
2. Purchase a movie at the Box
3. Make an On Demand transaction

These qualifying transactions are only complete once you make a successful payment (if applicable). Each disc is counted separately toward your status levels even thought they may be part of the same transaction. For example, you rent 2 discs under one transaction, your counter will increase by 2.

In the Perks program, once you reach a level, you'll be in it for the remainder of that year - plus the next year! For example, if you become a Superstar in March of this year, you'll be at least a Superstar for the rest of this year and all of next year. If you keep renting and purchasing enought to mecome a Legend during this time, you'll level up and be a Legend for the rest of that year and the next. Visit https://www.redbox.com/perks and scroll down the page to learn more about the different levels in the program.

Badges are part of the Perks program that can be earned for any activity. Badges are awesome to earn on their own, but Superstars and Legends also get points per earned badge.

1. Superstars: 50 points per badge
2. Legends: 100 points per badge

Visit https://www.redbox.com/perks and scroll to the More Ways To Earn section to learn more about Badges.

category.name: Using Chromecast
category.answer:
For more information on using Chromecast, refer to the table below:

Chromecasting Redbox On Demand from an Android or iOS device?

1. Your Android, iOS smartphone or tablet must be on the same wireless network as your Chromecast device.
2. On your smartphone or tablet, open the Redbox app, go to your Redbox Library, and find the title you want to Chromecast.
3. On the title details page, select the Chromecast icon and choose the Chromecast device you want to use to view the content.
4. Once connected, simply start playback of the title.

Chromecasting Redbox On Demand from a Computer

1. Your laptop or desktop computer must be on the same wireless network as your Chromecast device.
2. From your Chrome browser, access Redbox.com
3. Visit My Library, go to the title you want to Chromecast, initiate playback, select the Chromecast icon displayed in the player and choose the Chromecast device you want to use.
4. The Chromecast icon on your browser will turn blue if the cast is active.
5. To stop the cast, click the Chromecast icon and select Stop.

If you need more information on Chromecast, its available through Chromecast Support.
